translated: the King of the Gods,
and seventy-seven times
I was a King who rules the world.
A vast regional kingdom,
incalculable in number,
by the gift of half a robe,
I rejoice, being fearless.
And if I so wished today,
with the forests and the mountains,
I could cover it with robes,
the fruit of giving half a robe.
For a hundred thousand aeons,
the gift I gave then,
I do not know of a bad destination,
the fruit of giving half a robe.
